page.title: 03Mary Queen of Scots Visit
page.content: In 1564 Mary Queen of Scots visited the island and the occasion was commemorated by an inscribed stone bearing her Coat of Arms and the date.The stone was originally erected within the French fortress which was located at the southern end of the island. Today the stone is located above a gateway in the courtyard of the lighthouse and is beautifully painted. The Coat of Arms of Mary Queen of Scots consists of a sheild with a rampant lion on it, a white horse either side of it and a crown above it.
